title: ‘Welcome back to our place of work’ — U.K. Speaker Bercow as Parliament returns
text:
“Welcome back to our place of work.” John Bercow, Speaker of the House of Commons

That was the simple message from the Speaker of the House of Commons, John Bercow, as the U.K. Parliament returned to business on Wednesday, a day after the Supreme Court ruled Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s prorogation was unlawful.

British media outlets covered Johnson’s return to No. 10 Downing Street like a car chase, as the prime minister came back to the country from New York, where Johnson attended the United Nations General Assembly.

“The government accepts the judgement,” said the attorney general, Geoffrey Cox, as he rejected calls to resign.

The British pound GBPUSD, -0.8645% drifted lower on Wednesday after getting a bit of a lift from the Supreme Court ruling on Tuesday. The pound fell to $1.2431 from $1.2493.
